errors.error_description: Incorrect pip install command syntax missing '-r' flag for requirements file
correction_candidates: To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6380.
To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install --requirement requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6380.
To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip3 install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6380.
To install NetBox dependencies, run `python -m pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6380.
errors.golden_answer: To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6380.

errors.error_description: Specifies incorrect default Redis port (6380 instead of standard 6379)
correction_candidates: To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6379.
To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on the default port.
To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running locally.
To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6381.
errors.golden_answer: To install NetBox dependencies, run `pip install -r requirements.txt` and make sure to have Redis server running on port 6379.
